thread.title: Chara will miss Bruins opener vs Jets; not ready to return after injury
thread.title_full: Chara will miss Bruins opener vs Jets; not ready to return after injury

title: Chara will miss Bruins opener vs Jets; not ready to return after injury
text:
Chara will miss Bruins opener vs Jets; not ready to return after injury 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Thursday, October 08, 2015 01:07 PM EDT | Updated: Thursday, October 08, 2015 01:16 PM EDT Zdeno Chara of the Boston Bruins looks on during the game against the Buffalo Sabres during the second period in March, 2015. (Maddie Meyer/AFP) Bruins owner Jeremy Jacobs says both expansion options have advantages 
Boston Bruins defenceman Zdeno Chara will miss Thursday night's game against the Winnipeg Jets because he's not ready to return after an upper body injury. 
The 2009 Norris Trophy winner has been out since he sustained the injury in a Sept. 24 exhibition against the New York Rangers. Coach Claude Julien says after the morning skate that Chara won't be active for the season opener. 
Chara says he's just not ready. 
The Bruins are hoping to bounce back from a season in which they missed the playoffs for the first time since 2007. Zdeno Chara not playing tonight, per Julien — Boston Bruins (@NHLBruins) October 8, 2015 #NHLBruins will make do without Captain Zdeno Chara in tonight's season opener vs. Winnipeg. Projected lineup: http://t.co/kqz2xnA1Pq — Boston Bruins (@NHLBruins) October 8, 2015 Sponsored Links
